0px)}.owl-carousel .owl-controls .owl-nav .owl-prev,.owl-carousel .owl-controls .owl-nav .owl-next,.owl-carousel .owl-controls .owl-dot{cursor:pointer;cursor:hand;-webkit-user-select:none;-khtml-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none}.owl-carousel.owl-loaded{display:block}.owl-carousel.owl-loading{opacity:0;display:block}.owl-carousel.owl-hidden{opacity:0}.owl-carousel .owl-refresh .owl-item{display:none}.owl-carousel .mfp-container:before{display:none}.mfp-content{position:relative;display:inline-block;vertical-align:middle;margin:0 auto;text-align:left;z-index:1045}.mfp-inline-holder .mfp-content,.mfp-ajax-holder .mfp-content{width:100%;cursor:auto}.mfp-ajax-cur{cursor:progress}.mfp-zoom-out-cur,.mfp-zoom-out-cur .mfp-image-holder .mfp-close{cursor:-moz-zoom-out;cursor:-webkit-zoom-out;cursor:zoom-out}.mfp-zoom{cursor:pointer;cursor:-webkit-zoom-in;cursor:-moz-zoom-in;cursor:zoom-in}.mfp-auto-cursor .mfp-content{display:none}button.mfp-close,button.mfp-arrow{overflow:visible;cursor:pointer;background:transparent;border:0;-webkit-appearance:none;display:block;outline:none;padding:0;z-index:1046;box-shadow:none;touch-action:manipulation}button::-moz-focus-inner{padding:0;border:0}.mfp-close{width:44px;height:44px;line-height:44px;position:absolute;right:0;top:0;text-decoration:none;text-align:center;opacity:0.65;padding:0 #FFF;margin-left:39px}.mfp-arrow-right:before{border-left:27px solid #3F3F3F}.mfp-iframe-holder{padding-top:40px;padding-bottom:40px}.mfp-iframe-holder .mfp-content{line-height:0;width:100%;max-width:900px}.mfp-iframe-holder .mfp-close{top:-40px}.mfp-iframe-scaler{width:100%;height:0;overflow:hidden;padding-top:65%}.mfp-iframe-scaler 900px){.mfp-arrow{-webkit-transform:scale(0.75);transform:scale(0.75)}.mfp-arrow-left{-webkit-transform-origin:0;transform-origin:0}.mfp-arrow-right{-webkit-transform-origin:100%;transform-origin:100%}.mfp-container{padding-left:6px;padding-right:6px}}

 /*# sourceMappingURL=style.css.map */
   </style>
   <!-- css optimization -->
   <link as="style" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Cinzel:400,700" onload="this.onload=null;this.rel='stylesheet'" rel="preload"/>
   <noscript>
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Cinzel:400,700" rel="stylesheet"/>
   </noscript>
   <script>
    (function(){
             /*! loadCSS. [c]2017 Filament Group, Inc. MIT License */
             /* This file is meant as a standalone workflow for
              - testing support for link[rel=preload]
              - enabling async CSS loading in browsers that do not support rel=preload
              - applying rel preload css once loaded, whether supported or not.
              */
             (function( w ){
                 "use strict";
                 // rel=preload support test
                 if( !w.loadCSS ){
                     w.loadCSS = function(){};
                 }
                 // define on the loadCSS obj
                 var rp = loadCSS.relpreload = {};
                 // rel=preload feature support test
                 // runs once and returns a function for compat purposes
                 rp.support = (function(){
                     var ret;
                     try {
                         ret = w.document.createElement( "link" ).relList.supports( "preload" );
                     } catch (e) {
                         ret = false;
                     }
                     return function(){
                         return ret;
                     };
                 })();
 
                 // if preload isn't supported, get an asynchronous load by using a non-matching media attribute
                 // then change that media back to its intended value on load
                 rp.bindMediaToggle = function( link ){
                     // remember existing media attr for ultimate state, or default to 'all'
                     var finalMedia = link.media || "all";
 
                     function enableStylesheet(){
                         link.media = finalMedia;
                     }
 
                     // bind load handlers to enable media
                     if( link.addEventListener ){
                         link.addEventListener( "load", enableStylesheet );
                     } else if( link.attachEvent ){
                         link.attachEvent( "onload", enableStylesheet );
                     }
 
                     // Set rel and non-applicable media type to start an async request
                     // note: timeout allows this to happen async to let rendering continue in IE
                     setTimeout(function(){
                         link.rel = "stylesheet";
                         link.media = "only x";
                     });
                     // also enable media after 3 seconds,
                     // which will catch very old browsers (android 2.x, old firefox) that don't support onload on link
                     setTimeout( enableStylesheet, 3000 );
                 };
 
                 // loop through link elements in DOM
                 rp.poly = function(){
                     // double check this to prevent external calls from running
                     if( rp.support() ){
                         return;
                     }
                     var links = w.document.getElementsByTagName( "link" );
                     for( var i = 0; i < links.length; i++ ){
                         var link = links[ i ];
                         // qualify links to those with rel=preload and as=style attrs
                         if( link.rel === "preload" && link.getAttribute( "as" ) === "style" && !link.getAttribute( "data-loadcss" ) ){
                             // prevent rerunning on link
                             link.setAttribute( "data-loadcss", true );
                             // bind listeners to toggle media back
                             rp.bindMediaToggle( link );
                         }
                     }
                 };
 
                 // if unsupported, run the polyfill
                 if( !rp.support() ){
                     // run once at least
                     rp.poly();
 
                     // rerun poly on an interval until onload
                     var run = w.setInterval( rp.poly, 500 );
                     if( w.addEventListener ){
                         w.addEventListener( "load", function(){
                             rp.poly();
                             w.clearInterval( run );
                         } );
                     } else if( w.attachEvent ){
                         w.attachEvent( "onload", function(){
                             rp.poly();
                             w.clearInterval( run );
                         } );
                     }
                 }
 
 
                 // commonjs
                 if( typeof exports !== "undefined" ){
                     exports.loadCSS = loadCSS;
                 }
                 else {
                     w.loadCSS = loadCSS;
                 }
             }( typeof global !== "undefined" ? global : this ) );
         }());
   </script>
   <!-- css optimization -->
   <link as="style" href="https://use.typekit.net/hwj4mnn.css" onload="this.onload=null;this.rel='stylesheet'" rel="preload"/>
   <noscript>
    <link href="https://use.typekit.net/hwj4mnn.css" rel="stylesheet"/>
   </noscript>
   <script>
    (function(){
             /*! loadCSS. [c]2017 Filament Group, Inc. MIT License */
             /* This file is meant as a standalone workflow for
             - testing support for link[rel=preload]
             - enabling async CSS loading in browsers that do not support rel=preload
             - applying rel preload css once loaded, whether supported or not.
             */
             (function( w ){
                 "use strict";
                 // rel=preload support test
                 if( !w.loadCSS ){
                     w.loadCSS = function(){};
                 }
                 // define on the loadCSS obj
                 var rp = loadCSS.relpreload = {};
                 // rel=preload feature support test
                 // runs once and returns a function for compat purposes
                 rp.support = (function(){
                     var ret;
                     try {
                         ret = w.document.createElement( "link" ).relList.supports( "preload" );
                     } catch (e) {
                         ret = false;
                     }
                     return function(){
                         return ret;
                     };
                 })();
 
                 // if preload isn't supported, get an asynchronous load by using a non-matching media attribute
                 // then change that media back to its intended value on load
                 rp.bindMediaToggle = function( link ){
                     // remember existing media attr for ultimate state, or default to 'all'
                     var finalMedia = link.media || "all";
 
                     function enableStylesheet(){
                         link.media = finalMedia;
                     }
 
                     // bind load handlers to enable media
                     if( link.addEventListener ){
                         link.addEventListener( "load", enableStylesheet );
                     } else if( link.attachEvent ){
                         link.attachEvent( "onload", enableStylesheet );
                     }
 
                     // Set rel and non-applicable media type to start an async request
                     // note: timeout allows this to happen async to let rendering continue in IE
                     setTimeout(function(){
                         link.rel = "stylesheet";
                         link.media = "only x";
                     });
                     // also enable media after 3 seconds,
                     // which will catch very old browsers (android 2.x, old firefox) that don't support onload on link
                     setTimeout( enableStylesheet, 3000 );
                 };
 
                 // loop through link elements in DOM
                 rp.poly = function(){
                     // double check this to prevent external calls from running
                     if( rp.support() ){
                         return;
                     }
                     var links = w.document.getElementsByTagName( "link" );
                     for( var i = 0; i < links.length; i++ ){
                         var link = links[ i ];
                         // qualify links to those with rel=preload and as=style attrs
                         if( link.rel === "preload" && link.getAttribute( "as" ) === "style" && !link.getAttribute( "data-loadcss" ) ){
                             // prevent rerunning on link
                             link.setAttribute( "data-loadcss", true );
                             // bind listeners to toggle media back
                             rp.bindMediaToggle( link );
                         }
                     }
                 };
 
                 // if unsupported, run the polyfill
                 if( !rp.support() ){
                     // run once at least
                     rp.poly();
 
                     // rerun poly on an interval until onload
                     var run = w.setInterval( rp.poly, 500 );
                     if( w.addEventListener ){
                         w.addEventListener( "load", function(){
                             rp.poly();
                             w.clearInterval( run );
                         } );
                     } else if( w.attachEvent ){
                         w.attachEvent( "onload", function(){
                             rp.poly();
                             w.clearInterval( run );
                         } );
                     }
                 }
 
 
                 // commonjs
                 if( typeof exports !== "undefined" ){
                     exports.loadCSS = loadCSS;
                 }
                 else {
                     w.loadCSS = loadCSS;
                 }
             }( typeof global !== "undefined" ? global : this ) );
     }());
   </script>
   <script>
    /* Google Phone Number Conversion Code */
 
     /*Do not edit below*/
 
     var s3callback = function(formatted_number, unformatted_number) {
       // formatted_number: number to display, in same formatting as number
       //        number passed to _googWcmGet(). e.g
       //        '1-800-444-5555' in this case
       // unformatted_number: number to display without any formatting
       //         formatting. e.g. '18004445555'. This is the number
       //         that will be used in the “tel:” link'18004445555'
       var e = $('.ppc-number');
 
       //for replacing only the HREF
       var e2 = $('.ppc-href');
       e2.attr('href', "tel:"+ unformatted_number);
 
       e.innerHTML = "";
       if(e.is('a')){
         e.attr('href', "tel:"+ unformatted_number);
       }
       e.text(formatted_number);
     };
 
     $(window).load(function(){
       _googWcmGet(s3callback, '(520) 577-7777');
     });
   </script>
   <!-- google analytics -->
   <!-- Global site tag (gtag.js) - Google Analytics -->
   <script async="" src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=UA-121541488-1">
   </script>
   <script>
    window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
   function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
   gtag('js', new Date());
 
   gtag('config', 'UA-121541488-1');
   </script>
   <!-- what converts -->
   <script src="//scripts.iconnode.com/63724.js">
   </script>

       <!-- about -->

         <p class="year">
          Est. 1988
         </p>
         <h1>
          <img alt="Accident Lawyer Tucson" src="/assets/img/logo.png" width="400px"/>
         </h1>
         <p class="boutique">
          a boutique law firm
         </p>

          <span class="square wow fadeIn" data-wow-delay="1s" data-wow-duration="1s">

          1980 E. Fort Lowell Road, Suite 200
          <span class="block-tablet-up">
           Tucson, Arizona 85719
          </span>
         </a>
         <a class="address" href="https://www.google.com/maps/dir/34.1237175,-118.2550118/226+S+1st+Ave,+Yuma,+AZ+85364/@33.3737604,-117.555482,8z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m10!4m9!1m1!4e1!1m5!1m1!1s0x80d6f678cb7efb0d:0xde76d7c2a21b5e17!2m2!1d-114.6211224!2d32.7228166!3e3" target="_blank">

     <a class="banner-btn" href="/our-firm/verdicts-and-settlements/">
      <p>
       Verdicts &amp; Settlements
      </p>
      <span>
       <img alt="Accident Lawyer Tucson" src="/assets/img/white-arrow.png"/>
      </span>

    <div class="container">
     <div class="row intro">
      <div class="text-center">
       <h2>
        your
        <span class="primary">
         personal injury
        </span>
        <span class="block-tablet-up">
         attorneys in Arizona.
        </span>
       </h2>
      </div>
      <p>
       Thank you for considering Shultz &amp; Rollins, Ltd., as your personal injury and/or
       <strong>
        accident lawyer in Tuscon
       </strong>
       , Arizona.
 				We are a boutique law firm that specializes in assisting injured individuals obtaining the fair and
 				just compensation they deserve. Our personal injury firm with offices in Tucson and Yuma is comprehensive and focuses on cases involving serious injuries and deaths due to Motor Vehicle Accidents (including tire defects, roll overs, and roof crushes), Trucking Accidents, Defective Products, Medical Negligence, Nursing Home Negligence/Abuse, Medical Devices and
 				Pharmaceuticals. We handle major injury cases in other states; however, we concentrate
 				primarily in the State of Arizona.
      </p>
      <div class="random-and">
       <span class="fade">
        &amp;
       </span>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="vid-section mt-0">
      <div class="box">
       <a class="open-popup-link" href="#home-vid">
        <img alt="" src="/assets/img/home/home-vid.jpg"/>
        <div class="" id="home-vid">
         <style>
          .cgi-rt{position:relative;pointer-events: none;height:406px;max-height:406px;max-width:720px;}@media only screen and (max-width: 510px){.cgi-rt{max-height:255px;height:255px;}}
         </style>
         <div class="cgi-rt">
          <iframe allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="406" id="rtplayerjGs" src="https://elocallink.tv/e/?v=jGs&amp;ap=1" style="pointer-events: auto;position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:100%;height:100%;border:0;box-sizing: border-box;max-width: 720px;max-height: 406px;background: transparent;" type="text/html" width="720">
          </iframe>
         </div>
        </div>
        <img alt="" class="vid-arrow" src="assets/img/round-arrow.png"/>
       </a>

     <div class="row settlements">
      <div class="text">
       <h2>
        Verdicts &amp; settlements
       </h2>
       <p class="mb-50">
        Below is merely a sampling of the Shultz &amp; Rollins outcomes. All told, we have won over $160 million in settlements for our clients as medical practice, personal injury, defective products or as an
        <em>
         accident lawyer in Tucson
        </em>
        .
       </p>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $14
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For victims of a shooting
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $10
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For product liability injuries
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $8.5
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For victims of medical malpractice
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $5
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For wrongful termination
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $4
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For injuries of a cheerleading accident
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $3.9
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For victims of motor vehicle accident
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $3.4
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For victims of motor vehicle accident
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $3.3
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For injuries involved in a crane collapse
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $3.2
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For victims of pesticide ingestion
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="box">
        <p class="reward">
         <span>
          $3
         </span>
         Million
        </p>
        <p class="case-type">
         For victims of medical malpractice
        </p>
        <div class="clearfix">
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

     <div class="row doc-section pt-0 pb-0">
      <div class="box lt wow fadeIn" data-wow-delay="1s" data-wow-duration="1.5s">
       <a class="open-popup-link" href="#doclt">
        <img alt="Accident Lawyer Tucson" src="/assets/img/home/doc-section/doc-lt.jpg"/>
       </a>
       <div class="doc-info s3grid mfp-hide" id="doclt">
        <div class="feat2 img">
        </div>
        <div class="feat2 copy">
         <h2>
          Silas H. Shultz
         </h2>
         <p>
          Silas H. Shultz attended law school at the University of Arizona, where he was a member of the
 								Board of Editors for the Arizona Law Review. After graduation in 1966, he began his practice in
 								insurance defense, working for one of the most recognized firms in the field in the state of
 								Arizona. Mr. Shultz handled an extraordinarily high caseload defending suits involving personal
 								injury, product liability, wrongful death, medical malpractice, property damage and other
 								tortious acts.
         </p>
         <a class="view-all" href="/our-attorneys/silas-shultz/">
          <span class="square">
          </span>
          More
         </a>
        </div>
        <div class="random-and">
         <!--<img src="/assets/img/and.png" alt="">-->
         &amp;
        </div>
       </div>
       <span class="hover-name">
        Silas H. Shultz
       </span>
      </div>
      <div class="box rt wow fadeIn" data-wow-delay="1.3s" data-wow-duration="1.5s">
       <a class="open-popup-link" href="#docrt">
        <img alt="Accident Lawyer Tucson" src="/assets/img/home/doc-section/doc-rt.jpg"/>
       </a>
       <div class="doc-info flipped s3grid mfp-hide" id="docrt">
        <div class="feat2 img">
        </div>
        <div class="feat2 copy">
         <h2>
          Michael F. Rollins
         </h2>
         <p>
          Michael F. Rollins received his law degree from the University of Arizona College of Law in 1978
 								and was admitted to practice law in Arizona. Following graduation, Mr. Rollins accepted a
 								Federal Judicial Clerkship with the Honorable Carl A. Muecke, Chief Judge for the District of
 								Arizona. Upon completion, he began his practice in insurance defense, working for an
 								international law firm in its Phoenix office. He was elected to firm partnership and defended
 								Fortune 500 companies and Arizona clients in cases involving personal injury, product liability,
 								wrongful death, medical malpractice and labor law issues.
         </p>
         <a class="view-all" href="/our-attorneys/michael-rollins/">
          <span class="square">
          </span>
          More
         </a>
        </div>
        <div class="random-and">
         <!--<img src="/assets/img/and.png" alt="">-->
         &amp;
        </div>
       </div>
       <span class="hover-name">
        Michael F. Rollins
       </span>
      </div>
      <div class="random-and wow fadeIn" data-wow-delay="1.5s" data-wow-duration="1.5s">
       <!--<img src="/assets/img/and.png" alt="">-->
       &amp;
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="schedule-cta">
      <div class="row">
       <div class="box">
        <p>
         At
         <span class="bold">
          Shultz &amp; Rollins,
         </span>
         we believe in the
         <span class="bold italic">
          fairness of juries
         </span>
         under our American judicial system to
         <span class="bold italic">
          level the playing field
         </span>
         for citizens, regardless of their wealth or power. We are dedicated to protecting the Constitutional Right of trial by jury.
        </p>
        <p class="bold">
         Schedule a
         <span class="bold italic">
          free, confidential,
         </span>
         consultation
         <span class="block-tablet-up">
          &amp; preliminary case evaluation.
         </span>
        </p>
        <a class="btn wow fadeInDown mt-30-tablet-up" href="/_old/contact/">
         Schedule
        </a>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="row half-image seana pt-0 mt-40-phone wow fadeIn" data-wow-delay="0.9s" data-wow-duration="1s">
      <div aria-label="Accident Lawyer Tucson" class="media" role="img">
      </div>
      <div class="copy padded">
       <div class="inner">
        <div class="text-center">
         <h2>
          Seana Scholtemeyer
         </h2>
        </div>
        <div class="text-center">
         <h4 class="sub-title wow fadeIn" data-wow-delay="0.5s" data-wow-duration="1s">
          Attorney
         </h4>
        </div>
        <p class="thin">
         Seana Scholtemeyer received her law degree from California Western School of Law. Following
 						graduation, Ms. Scholtemeyer began her practice at a firm handling cases involving creditor’s
 						remedies, civil litigation, receiverships, bankruptcy and appeals. Her experience collecting
 						monies owed on behalf of creditors and lienholders affords her unique knowledge into the inner workings of debt collectors and provides an advantage in negotiating medical bills and
 						liens for injured clients.
         <a class="view-all" href="/our-attorneys/seana-scholtemeyer/">
          <span class="square">
          </span>
          More
         </a>
        </p>
       </div>
       <img alt="Accident Lawyer Tucson" class="img" src="/assets/img/media/seana.jpg"/>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="home-group">
      <div class="lrg-and">
       <span class="wow fadeInUp" data-wow-delay="1s" data-wow-duration="1s">
        &amp;
       </span>
      </div>
      <div class="box">
       <div class="text-center">
        <h2>
         <span class="primary block">
          Your team
         </span>
         at Shultz &amp; Rollins
        </h2>
       </div>
       <p>
        For over three decades, Shultz &amp; Rollins, Ltd. has exclusively dedicated its efforts to the causes of
 						consumers and ordinary people in cases involving personal injury and death due to Motor
 						Vehicle Accidents, Trucking Accidents, Defective Products, Medical Negligence, Nursing Home
 						Negligence/Abuse, Medical Devices and Pharmaceuticals. Our law offices strive to achieve the
 						highest standard of excellence in representing our clients in these areas. We have a long-
 						standing history of million and multimillion dollar verdicts and settlements. In order to
 						successfully prosecute these types of cases we agree to represent only a select number of
 						people at any one time.
       </p>
       <a class="view-all" href="/our-attorneys/">
        <span class="square">
        </span>
        More
       </a>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="devil-details">
      <div class="row s3grid">
       <div class="feat2 lt">
        <h2>
         <span class="primary">
          The Devil's
         </span>
         in
         <span class="block-desktop">
          the details
         </span>
        </h2>
       </div>
       <div class="feat2 rt">
        <p>
         Our experienced lawyers will conduct an extensive investigation, collect evidence, talk with
 					witnesses, obtain records and hire experts in order to properly evaluate and prove your case. If you need an
         <strong>
          auto accident 						lawyer in Yuma, AZ
         </strong>
         or if you’ve suffered personal injury, negligence, or any other legal grievance, you may be entitled to
 					recover damages for your emotional and economic losses. Please contact the attorneys at
 					Shultz &amp; Rollins in Yuma, AZ and Tucson, AZ today to schedule a free, confidential consultation
 					and receive a preliminary case evaluation.
        </p>
       </div>
      </div>
